description: This is a schema for responses in the JSON API format. For more, see http://jsonapi.org
title: JSON API Schema

_88meta.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

_88links.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

___self.description: A `self` member, whose value is a URL for the relationship itself (a "relationship URL"). This URL allows the client to directly manipulate the relationship. For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.

oneOf.description: A string containing the link's URL.

___href.description: A string containing the link's URL.

$eref.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object.

___status.description: The HTTP status code applicable to this problem, expressed as a string value.

$eref.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

___self.description: A `self` member, whose value is a URL for the relationship itself (a "relationship URL"). This URL allows the client to directly manipulate the relationship. For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.

___code.description: An application-specific error code, expressed as a string value.

___title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem. It **SHOULD NOT** change from occurrence to occurrence of the problem, except for purposes of localization.

___id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

$eref.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

___detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

___parameter.description: A string indicating which query parameter caused the error.

___pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

oneOf.description: A string containing the link's URL.

___href.description: A string containing the link's URL.

$eref.description: Non-standard meta-information that can not be represented as an attribute or relationship.

_88link.description: A link **MUST** be represented as either: a string containing the link's URL or a link object.

___id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the problem.

___parameter.description: A string indicating which query parameter caused the error.

___pointer.description: A JSON Pointer [RFC6901] to the associated entity in the request document [e.g. "/data" for a primary data object, or "/data/attributes/title" for a specific attribute].

$eref.description: A resource object **MAY** contain references to other resource objects ("relationships"). Relationships may be to-one or to-many. Relationships can be specified by including a member in a resource's links object.

For example, it would allow a client to remove an `author` from an `article` without deleting the people resource itself.
